metadata.sermon_start_end: Ich will nicht auf das ganze Hohelied der Liebe eingehen, sondern nur einen Vers herausgreifen. »Sie verträgt alles, sie glaubt alles, sie hofft alles, sie duldet alles.« Ist das möglich? Ist das nicht diese bodenlose Überforderung, die das Christentum so unlebbar macht und so hilflos? [...] In Gott ist genau der Zustand des großen Alles, in dem wir nehmen und geben, für alle zum allein Wirklichen geworden. Weil wir mit Gott bereits in dem Verhältnis stehen, das gelegentlich für jeden aufleuchtet und erfahrbar wird, lässt sich dieses Verhältnis des großen Alles übertragen. So soll es sein, so wird es sein.

1_specific_bible_passage.findings: While the preacher selects a specific verse (v. 7), the text is treated as a springboard for a general philosophy of love rather than a unique revelation. The preacher fails to identify what is in this text that can be found nowhere else, instead reducing it to a general 'eroticization of life'.
quotes: Ich will nicht auf das ganze Hohelied der Liebe eingehen, sondern nur einen Vers herausgreifen.
1_specific_bible_passage.improvement_point: Identify the specific theological weight of 'panta' (all things) in the context of the Cross, rather than equating it with erotic fulfillment.

2_exegesis_original_context.findings: There is no evidence of original language study or historical-critical awareness. The original context of the Corinthian church (conflicts, charismata) is entirely absent. The exegesis is replaced by personal experience and cultural criticism.
quotes: Ehrlich gesagt, ich kenne das, ich habe diese Erfahrung gemacht... in erotischen geglückten Beziehungen.
2_exegesis_original_context.improvement_point: Incorporate the historical context of the Corinthian congregation to understand why Paul defines love in these specific terms.

3_application_concrete_contemporary.findings: The application is concrete regarding the critique of the Eros/Agape distinction and sexism, but it remains within the realm of 'general truths' about human relationships. It lacks the specificity of the hearer's world beyond the preacher's personal romantic insights.
quotes: Die sexistische menschenfeindliche Tradition des Christentums hat Agape von Eros getrennt.
3_application_concrete_contemporary.improvement_point: Move beyond the preacher's personal erotic experiences to address the concrete 'misery' or 'gratitude' of the congregation's daily life.

4_interwoveness_exposition_application.findings: Exposition is almost entirely swallowed by application. The text does not 'expound' the hearer; rather, the preacher's ideology 'expounds' the text. The 'present' of revelation is replaced by a psychological state.
quotes: Das Wort GOTT ist eine Vokabel, um diese Erotisierung des Ganzen auszudrücken.
4_interwoveness_exposition_application.improvement_point: Allow the text to stand over against the preacher's experience, creating a dialogue between the Word and the contemporary situation.

5_three_parts_misery_redemption_gratitud.findings: Misery is defined as 'unsuccessful relationships' or 'sexism,' not misery before God. Redemption is seen as the 'erotization of the whole,' which is a human-centered psychological shift rather than a divine act. Gratitude is missing as a response to grace.
quotes: Ist das nicht diese bodenlose Überforderung, die das Christentum so unlebbar macht...?
5_three_parts_misery_redemption_gratitud.improvement_point: Reframe 'misery' as the inability to love as God loves, which requires a redemption found outside of human erotic success.

6_two_ways_seriousness_of_choice.findings: The 'two ways' are non-existent. There is no sense of being lost or the seriousness of divine judgment. The sermon suggests an inevitable progression toward 'the state of the great All.'
quotes: So soll es sein, so wird es sein. Vereinigung ist das Gesetz des Ganzen.
6_two_ways_seriousness_of_choice.improvement_point: Address the possibility of 'being lost in time'—the failure to answer God's call to love—to take the hearer's choices seriously.

7_christocentric_grace.findings: Christ is mentioned only as a 'message' or a 'vocation,' not as the telos or the incarnate God. Grace is replaced by the 'luck' of a successful relationship. The doctrine of the two natures is absent.
quotes: ...was in der Botschaft Jesu steckt und in den besten Stellen bei Paulus...
7_christocentric_grace.improvement_point: Present Christ not as a teacher of eroticism, but as the one who alone fulfills 1 Cor 13, through whom grace becomes possible for the hearer.

8_depth_and_length.findings: At approximately 480 words, the sermon lasts less than 5 minutes. According to Dekker/Miskotte, it lacks the 'breadth' necessary for theological depth.
8_depth_and_length.improvement_point: Expand the sermon to at least 20 minutes to allow for proper exposition of the text and a more nuanced application.

overall_assessment.summary: The text fails to meet the formal and substantive requirements of a sermon as defined by Dekker. It lacks exegesis, is far too short, and replaces the Word of God with a psychological-erotic philosophy. The seriousness of the 'two ways' and the central role of Christ as Lord are entirely missing.
strengths: Concrete critique of the historical Eros/Agape dualism.
A clear, albeit non-biblical, central thesis regarding the 'erotization of life'.
weaknesses: Insufficient length (under 5 minutes) prevents any depth.
Substitution of personal experience for biblical exegesis.
Absence of Christ as the divine telos and the reality of grace.
Lack of the 'two ways' and the seriousness of human responsibility before God.
overall_assessment.final_judgment_according_to_dekker: This is not a sermon. It is a brief personal reflection or a secular speech on the philosophy of love. It fails the 'bicycle mechanic' test: the wheel of the Word is not mounted to the ministry of the church.
